name: Amber Mellen
text: WORST HOSPITAL EVER!! DO NOT GO HERE. I was visiting Atmore from Pensacola with severe kidney issues. I asked several times for pain medicine to subside my pain, and they wouldn't give it to me. Instead, they made me sit and cry in pain, and told me I needed to provide a urine sample to see if I qualify for pain meds. They were very rude and judgmental. They make you feel unwanted and like a drug addict when all you are waiting is something to ease your pain, and I would've even been okay with ibuprofen, but they wouldn't even give me that.

name: Dalton
text: Very kind, and respectful doctors. I went in here, and im still in here at the time of writing (in ICU) but so far I have 0 complaints about any of the doctors. They have all been very kind, and friendly, and beyond helpful in this hard time for me. Thank you so much to my local little hospital, keep it up!

name: Valerie Vallejo
text: 10/10 would not recommend

name: Adrienne Winand
text: Worst hospital I've ever been in. Went to the E.R. for a gastritis flare.  Gave me some liquid med that helped but left with no prescription and just a referral.  Waste of time and money.  4 hours later I'm back to feeling just as bad as when I went.

name: Stephanie Still
text: My son had a four wheeler accident on May 19th 2019 the doctors were very peaceful he said let them know thank you for all y’all did and they said most people are dead or paralyzed he is neither Praise God !!!

name: Heather Weaver
text: Oh gosh, is it a bad thing that I'm the first to rate this hospital? 😶 Thank goodness I use other hospitals other than this one. Most nurses are helpful, but some of those doctors need to trade salaries with the nurses. Not a very clean place either. Sanitation has always been a huge issue!

name: Heather Ryals
text: Super great doctor that was there on 9/29/2019 @1am.  Very well mannered and great bed side manner.  The nurse there was super nice and provided great services as well.

name: Callie Smith
text: Horrible experience every time. They make you feel worse than you already feel being in the ER. They have no care, the staff talk among each other  about other members of the staff instead of assisting patients. They plan their weekends talk about lost animals and put you last. They treat you like a total stranger instead of someone who is sick. I absolutely hate this place and if I would have been aware of where i was being taken to in my condition I would have suggested somewhere else immediately..

name: Wendy Burgess
text: I was recently admitted to this hospital and I had nothing but an awesome experience all the way around. From the housekeeper's, dietary, lab techs, and cna's to the nurses and doctors. Even anesthesia during my unexpected surgery and the recovery nurses were wonderful. They were all very attentive to my needs and checked on me regularly and made me feel like they cared. The nurses would come in at the beginning of their shifts and introduce themselves and were there for me all through each shift, no matter what I needed. And the doctors were like clockwork rounding early.  I never had to wonder when the dr was going to come see me because they were there every morning to see me at the same time and let me know what was going on with my care, test results, etc. I couldn't have chosen a better hospital to have to be in for 4 full days. I can not thank the staff enough for the quality of care they provided. I would definitely recommend anyone to go there.

name: Korrell Penn
text: The entire staff in the ER took great care of me.... Best county hospital I've ever been to

name: Karen Thomas
text: Really good place everyone was so nice and all of them know what the were doing very clean and helpful.

name: Terri Watkins
text: I have been Hospitalized here twice in the last couple of months and have had 2 visits to the ER, each experience was great, from the Drs. on call Dr. Macbeth and Dr. Jon Yoder, both went above and beyond trying to get to the bottom of my problem and they did! The whole ER staff was very caring and concerned and I have no complaints at all! The entire Hospital staff was very accommodating and showed true concern from the Lab employees to the ICU staff! If applicable I would give a bigger rating......awesome service!

name: C D
text:
Worst hospital experience ever!
Like another person wrote, you walk in with an ailment, but will be treated for something completely different.
In my case I was seriously bruised up from an accident. Dr. Elizabeth Bataglia came back a couple of minutes after a urine sample was taken and told me that I didn't have any injuries from the accident but that they would treat me for an STD instead, right in front of my fiancé!

We went to a different health care provider a few days later, who also took urine samples from the both of us.
They said they would send it off to a lab to get a correct result.
It came back negative!

We have been together for years, so how could I have an STD according to Dr. Bataglia but not according to the lab?!?!
Obviously someone (the staff, nurses or doctor) made a serious mistake in giving me an incorrect diagnosis, and simply being diagnosed with an STD is an embarrassment in itself!

This hospital and their personnel should be ashamed of themselves for not taking patients nor their health seriously!

That was the last time we went to this hospital. Ever!
They don't have to worry about us coming back.
We will be going to a different health care provider from now on!

Unless you want an incorrect diagnosis, Stay Away from Atmore Community Hospital!

name: PoBoyFlowCHE
text:
Took my fiancee to the ER a few days after being released from a better hospital due to kidney failure from a severe infection. The staff is rude, unprofessional, and they do not seem to care if they help you it all. Seems like they just want to get you out instead of taking time to actually investigate and treat your ailment. I walked outside to make a phone call to my fiancee's family to inform them that she was sick again, and when I came back in the lady at the front desk rolled her eyes and very rudely stated I was not allowed to see her per hospital rules. So if you have a loved one dying don't expect to be able to say goodbye in the emergency room at this hospital.

All in all a very negative experience and she didn't receive any treatment at all. In my opinion you are better off taking your loved one or yourself down to Mobile or Pensacola if you have an emergency and the time to get there.

name: Colleen Papajohn
text: TERRIBLE PLACE I WOULDN'T EVEN TAKE MY DOG THERE U WALK IN WITH ONE PROBLEM AND WALK OUT WITH A DIAGNOSIS OF SOMETHING THAT HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH YOUR PROBLEM, MOST OF THE NURSES AND DR.S ARE RUDE AND DUMB AS HELL THEY HAVE NO BEDSIDE MANNERS THEY DONT LISTEN WHEN U TRY AND EXPLAIN WHATS WRONG AMD WHAT YOUR PAIN IS THEY JUST DONT CARE! IT IS LITERALLY A BANDAID HOSPITAL THAT'LL PUT IT ON THE WRONG WOUND!

name: jonathan cofield
text: Wish I could give it a lower rating than 1 star. WORST hospital ever! took my mom in, the nurses were rude. One nurse even made the statement," you are wearing me out tonight.." All because my mom had seizure and she didnt even think nothing of it. Doctor did not help her. She was extremely weak. Did not run sufficient tests. She couldnt even walk when we took her in. This is a 75 yr old woman we are talking about. And they didnt even try to see if she could walk. It was like they didnt believe us. NEVER NEVER AGAIN!! Took her to Sacred Heart. WAY better hospital!!!

text: Dr. Ashford delivered all three of my children and I’ve been going to him for years. Since 2009. However, the last few times I’ve been have not been the same. Extra staff has been added.  The front desk still the same , but the nurses, cnas that call you in the back are not friendly ,  vibe and attitude not right for a doctor’s office.   Today , like the last two times ; I waited an hour and a half to go in the back. The CNA that called me back..... eyes rolling like she had a problem and didn’t want to be there.   The back is too crowded, and unprofessional. Nurses everywhere but still slow. Really don’t feel like a doctors office at all. Not going back , changing my doctor. I rather go to the health department.

name: Meshia
text:
If I could have done this review without giving any stars, I would have. But, this star is for LaTory Franks. She really deserves all 5, but this review is not about her. Dr. Ashford has been my gynecologist for more than 10 years, so needless to say, I trusted him. He performed a surgery on me that in turned almost took my life, because he continued to diagnose me inaccurately from the pain I was having after the surgery. I ended up with sepsis, diverticulitis, and an ostomy bag. I have never had any marks on my body, not even my stomach, but after Dr. Ashford's surgery, my stomach looks like a train track with connect the dots around it. This sent me into a depressed state. I have to see this every day when I look at myself.
After which he had no remorse or concern for. He was always nice until he did something wrong. He acts as if he is some type of god with people lives in his hand. But, everyone has to answer to THE MOST HIGH GOD!! I would definitely not refer my worst enemy, let along family, friends, or associates to him or cahaba medical. Even after I did my grievance report concerning this issue, and was notified that his attorneys told him to contact me, to this day, nothing has been done, and, no one from cahaba medical has contacted me since, because they don't care either.

name: debbie franklin
text: This clinic should be held accountable for the lives they have destroyed...during a 9 month period my appointments were continually being canceled even though they were well aware I had been in the hospital and had to return to the hospital because of these cancellations. Even the ER doctors couldn’t understand why they wouldn’t even authorize a needed test and never ordered a single blood, urine test or a scan for a 50+ year old woman who was suffering from severe abdominal pain that after numerous attempts to see a doctor was finally diagnosed by DCH hospital with advanced ovarian cancer that spread all over the abdomen. The pharmacy couldn’t even get Maude Whatley to authorize basic blood pressure and stomach meds. The first thing the ER doctor asked me was how I could not know something serious was wrong.... I did know, I just couldn’t get a single test done in this place. Hopefully justice will be served because it’s certainly not fair that the ones responsible can just continue with their lives without consequences!

name: Austin Blair
text: One of the worst clinics I’ve unfortunately had the opportunity to visit. No one operates the phones, it’s near impossible to actually get on the phone with an actual HUMAN working there. Then you’ll be waiting for 45 minutes in a room because the doctor “forgot!” to come by. I was prescribed a medication that gave me SEVERE side effects, and when I called this office for help they gave me nothing. I couldn’t even get a call back from the doctor that prescribed me this medication after leaving a message with the clinic, all the while I’m vomiting and had diarrhea to no end. I will never be going back.

The 8th person in the room was a doctor who would not let me hold my 4 year olds hand or calm my 8 year old son with autism down when he was panicking from his brothers screams. I sat in the lobby for an extra 20 minutes waiting with my frightened and aggravated children waiting for immunizations record.
I spent 4 hours in this facility and did not receive the care and services my family deserved.

name: Anthony Cornelius
text: Nice employees

resp.text:
Thank you for providing your feedback and letting us know about this issue, Anthony. We set a high standard for ourselves and are truly sorry to hear that this standard was not met in your interaction with us. In an effort to resolve any issues that you may have had, someone from our office will be reaching out to you.

Thank you!

Cahaba Medical Care - Centreville

text:
I have been seeing Dr. Yartins for over a year now.  I have had 4 different Doctors since 2015 when I started using Cahaba Medical Center and by far,  Dr. Yartins is the Best Doctor I have had.
She will give you as much time as you need,  she gives 110% in every way possible.  Dr. Yartins has been so great at helping me with my issues,  she worked so very hard to find me the best medication for my sweating and all of my other issues.
I can't say enough wonderful things about her. I look forward to my visits with her.
Thank you Dr. Yartins for being such a awesome person.
